Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Reverend Henrietta Carter, Mariner's Temple Baptist Church, 3 Henry Street, New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gerson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Henrietta Carter, Mariner's Temple Baptist Church, 3 Henry Street, New York, N.Y.

Council Member Gerson moved  that the Invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 1, 2004 be adopted and printed by Council Member Jackson.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Jackson moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 1, 2004 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Perkins:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 161 Lenox Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 9, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20045468 TCM.)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 161 Lenox Avenue, Manhattan (20045468TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution acknowledging the crucial role that grandparents in New York City play in raising grandchildren, and calling upon the appropriate Council committee to hold a hearing to further explore this issue.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Acknowledging the crucial role that grandparents in NYC play in raising grandchildren.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the New York State Assembly for passing A.9710, a bill that would increase the minimum wage to $7.10, and calling upon the New York State Senate to pass the accompanying legislation, S.3291-C, and for the Governor to sign the bill into law.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The following 3 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Felder, Vallone Jr. and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the state minimum wage from $5.15 to $7.10 per hour.

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the dates of expiration of licenses and license plates for tow trucks and tow truck drivers.
Items.MatterName: Dates of expiration of licenses and license plates for tow trucks and tow truck drivers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to rates for arterial towers.
Items.MatterName: In relation to rates for arterial towers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Division of Probation and Correctional Alternatives to distribute State Probation funding equitably, especially recognizing the disproportionate share of adult felons and juvenile delinquents supervised by the New York City Department of Probation who would otherwise be confined in State custody.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: NYS Division of Probation and Correctional Alternatives to distribute State Probation funding equitably.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to oppose the proposed federal temporary guest worker program and to support the passing of comprehensive immigration reform that includes permanent legalization and fair worker protection for immigrants.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The following 6 Council Members formally voted against the passage of this item: Council Members Avella, Felder, Gallagher, Lanza, Vallone Jr. and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Congress to oppose the proposed federal temporary guest worker program and to support the passing of comprehensive immigration reform.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Resolution calling upon the United States Government to initiate an immediate inquiry into the handling of the case of United States Army Chaplain, Captain James Y. Yee.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The following 2 Council Members formally voted against the passage of the item: Council Members Avella and Lanza.  The following 2 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Member Vallone Jr. and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Inquiry into the handling of the case of United States Army Chaplain, Captain James Y. Yee.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact legislation permitting reciprocal, direct-to-consumer wine shipment in and out of New York State.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Member Vallone, Jr.
Items.MatterName: Enact legislation permitting reciprocal, direct-to-consumer wine shipment in and out of NYS.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Skelos, S.2124-B, and Assembly Members DiNapoli, Hooper, Sidikman and Weisenberg, et al, A.6064-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to allowing the transfer of membership from the New York city police pension fund to the metropolitan transportation authority police pension fund”.
Items.MatterName: Allowing the transfer of membership from the New York city police pension fund to the mta police pension fund (S.2124-B, A.6064-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6223, and Assembly Member Colton, A.9810, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the retirement and social security law, in relation to including a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed by the police department of the city of New York or by the office of the chief medical examiner of such city in the title evidence and property control specialist who are subject to articles 11 and 15 of the retirement and social security law”.
Items.MatterName: Including a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed by the police department (S.6223, A.9810)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.5968, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.9484, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to benefits for certain peace officers in the city of New York who are injured in the performance of their duties”.
Items.MatterName: Benefits for certain peace officers in the city of New York who are injured in the performance of their duties (S.5968, A.9484)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.5305-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8701-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey title of certain property to Gus Jenkins”.
Items.MatterName: Reconvey title of certain property to Gus Jenkins (S.5305-A, A.8701-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.6430-A, and Assembly Members Grannis, McLaughlin, Dinowitz, Grodenchik, Lafayette, Bing, Gianaris, O’Donnell, Weprin, Perry, Sanders and Stringer, et al, A.9610-B, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to partial abatement of real property taxes”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Partial abatement of real property taxes (S.6430-A, A.9610-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.5394-B, and Committee on Rules, A.8718-B, “AN ACT to establish the date of commencement of membership of certain individuals in the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Establish the date of commencement of membership of certain individuals (S.5394-B, A.8718-B)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that commercial shopping establishments that maintain a parking area of at least 200 spaces install, maintain and operate surveillance cameras in order to deter crime.
Items.MatterName: Require commercial shopping establishments that maintain a parking area of at least 200 spaces install, maintain and operate surveillance cameras in order to deter crime.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Council of the City of New York to support the Kingsbridge Heights community in its efforts to play a decisive role in the utilization of the Kingsbridge Armory.
Items.MatterName: Kingsbridge Heights community in its efforts to play a decisive role in the utilization of the Kingsbridge Armory.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of H.R. 3386, sponsored by Congresswoman Barbara Lee, which would provide assistance to combat infectious diseases and establish a comprehensive health infrastructure in the Republic of Haiti.
Items.MatterName: Provide assistance to combat infectious diseases and establish a comprehensive health infrastructure in the Republic of Haiti.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of H.R. 141, sponsored by Congresswoman Barbara Lee, which would disavow the “doctrine of preemption.”
Items.MatterName: Disavow the "doctrine of preemption."

Items.Title: Resolution in support of H.R. 3919, sponsored by Congresswoman Barbara Lee, which would establish an Independent Commission on the 2004 Coup d’Etat in the Republic of Haiti.
Items.MatterName: Establish an Independent Commission on the 2004 Coup d'Etat in the Republic of Haiti.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to the timely and efficient procurement of client services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts due back on 8/13/2004.
Items.MatterName: The timely and efficient procurement of client services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to hold an oversight hearing on the implementation of a Communications Based Train Control system on the Canarsie Line and into the further intentions of the New York City Transit Authority regarding the continued assignment of trained conductors to trains in the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Hold hearing on the implementation of a Communications Based Train Control system on the Canarsie Line.

Items.Title: Resolution offering the Council’s full support for the “Invisible No More!” campaign that is dedicated to winning home health aide contracts that mandate a Living Wage of $10 an hour by 2006, health benefits for home health aides and their families, paid vacation time and sick leave.
Items.MatterName: Offering the Council's full support for the "Invisible No More" campaign.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to the department of citywide administrative services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts due back on 8/13/2004.
Items.MatterName: Department of citywide administrative services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend to administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of parking meter regulations on Sundays.
Items.MatterName: Suspension of parking meter regulations on Sundays.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Education to provide personnel and disciplinary records to any nonpublic school that considers hiring a former or current Department of Education employee.
Items.MatterName: DOE to provide personnel and disciplinary records to any nonpublic school that considers hiring a former or current DOE employee.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to maintain weekend express service on the X27 and X28 lines running from Bay Ridge and Bensonhurst to Midtown Manhattan beyond the May 31, 2004 termination date.
Items.MatterName: MTA to maintain weekend express service on the X27 and X28 lines beyond the May 31, 2004 termination date.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to multiple submissions of contractor information.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts due back on 8/13/2004.
Items.MatterName: Multiple submissions of contractor information.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to alternatives to competitive sealed bidding.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts due back on 8/13/2004.
Items.MatterName: Alternatives to competitive sealed bidding.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to certain benefits and real property tax exemptions for housing development fund companies organized under article eleven of the private housing finance law.
Items.MatterName: Housing Development Fund Companies, Benefits/Real Property

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to pass H.R. 3444, introduced by Representative DeLauro, and S.2108, introduced by Senator Harkin, which would ensure that consumers receive information about the nutritional content of restaurant and vending machine food.
Items.MatterName: Ensure that consumers receive information about the nutritional content of restaurant and vending machine food.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the retention of candidates on eligible lists.
Items.MatterName: The retention of candidates on eligible lists.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the penalties for failure to use a safety locking device and requiring that in certain circumstances law enforcement officers be required to use a safety locking device.
Items.MatterName: Increase penalties for failure to use safety locking devices.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Board of Education to mandate that all school children in grade five or lower be required to remain at school until a parent or authorized person of responsible age picks them up.
Items.MatterName: Mandate that children be picked up by parent or authorized person.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the installation of a stop sign or traffic control signal at every intersection immediately adjacent to any high school or other school below high school level in New York City.
Items.MatterName: Installation of a stop sign or traffic control signal at every intersection immediately adjacent to any high school or other school below high school level in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the families of the victims of Flight 587 in their efforts to establish a permanent memorial on a piece of land located at Beach Channel Drive and 126th Street in the Queens community of Belle Harbor to honor all those who died tragically on that flight on November 12, 2001.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Supporting the families of the victims of Flight 587 in their efforts to establish a permanent memorial.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Police Department to accept electronic benefit transfer cards that have the cardholder’s photograph as a valid form of identification.
Items.MatterName: NYPD to accept electronic benefit transfer cards that have the cardholder's photograph as a valid form of identification.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact A.7018-A/S.3109-A, the New York State Cultural Development Areas Act, which creates the New York State cultural development program; provides for the designation of cultural development areas and provides for certain tax benefits within those areas.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Enact the New York State Cultural Development Areas Act (A.7018-A / S.3109-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the shipment of solid waste between boroughs and the alteration of solid waste management facilities.
Items.MatterName: Shipment of solid waste between boroughs and the alteration of solid waste management facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution designating the month of May 2004 as Security Officers Appreciation Month.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Security Officers Appreciation Month, May 2004

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend to administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to suspending the activation of parking meters on Sundays.
Items.MatterName: Suspending parking meter regulations on Sundays.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency power in firehouses.
Items.MatterName: Emergency power in firehouses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency power in police precincts.
Items.MatterName: Emergency power in police precincts.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 79th birthday of Malcolm X on May 19th, 2004.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 79th birthday of Malcolm X on May 19th, 2004.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress and the President to repeal the 2003 tax breaks for wealthy Americans and large corporations, and restore funding for critical domestic priorities.
Items.MatterName: Repeal the 2003 tax breaks for wealthy Americans and large corporations, and restore funding for critical domestic priorities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Senate to adopt the “Nursing Care Quality Protection Act” (S.3255), which would provide the public with information regarding nursing staffing levels at hospitals and nursing homes and prohibit those who are not registered nurses (RNs) or licensed practical nurses (LPNs) from portraying themselves to the public as "nurses."
Items.MatterName: "Nursing Care Quality Protection Act" (S.3255)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to adopt A.8560-A/S.4713, which would establish a reporting system to monitor the supply and demand for registered professional nurses and establish minimum RN to patient ratios within a staffing system designed to promote quality health care.
Items.MatterName: Establish a reporting system to monitor the supply and demand for registered professional nurses and establish minimum RN (A.8560-A/S.4713)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to adopt A.3897/A.6251/S.680, which would restrict the consecutive number of hours that nurses are required to work, except in emergencies.
Items.MatterName: Restrict the consecutive number of hours that nurses are required to work (A.3897, A.6251, S.680)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to agencies that contract with not-for-profit organizations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts.
Items.MatterName: Agencies that contract with not-for-profit organizations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to newsracks.
Items.MatterName: In relation to newsracks.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.6430-A, and Assembly Members Grannis, McLaughlin, Dinowitz, Grodenchik, Lafayette, Bing, Gianaris, O’Donnell, Weprin, Perry, Sanders and Stringer, et al, A.9610-B, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to partial abatement of real property taxes”.
Items.MatterName: Partial abatement of real property taxes (S.6430-A, A.9610-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members A. Perry, Jacobs, McLaughlin, P. Rivera, Seddio, Heastie and A. Cohen, et al, A.5229, “AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the environmental control board adjudication of disputes concerning the blocking of a driveway; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.
Items.MatterName: Environmental control board adjudication of disputes concerning the blocking of a driveway (A.5229)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.4961-A, and Assembly Members Abbate and Klein, A.7187-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to refunding certain member contributions made pursuant to chapter 96 of the laws of 1995”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation due back on 9/23/2004.
Items.MatterName: Refunding certain member contributions (S.4961-A, A.7187-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.5394-B, and Committee on Rules, A.8718-B, “AN ACT to establish the date of commencement of membership of certain individuals in the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Establish the date of commencement of membership of certain individuals (S.5394-B, A.8718-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Marchi, Morahan, Padavan and Trunzo, S.2234-B, and Assembly Members Lavelle, Seddio and Weisenberg, et al, A.1349-C, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund to all New York city police officers, firefighters, housing police and transit police”.
Items.MatterName: Extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund (S.2234-B, A.1349-C)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Hassell-Thompson, S.7002, and Committee on Rules, A.10913, “AN ACT to authorize James M. James to transfer retirement service credit from the New York state and local employees’ retirement system to the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Authorize James M. James to transfer retirement service credit (S.7002, A.10913)

Items.Title: Resolution requesting that the Congress of the United States and the New York State Legislature renew the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation (TEUC) program.
Items.MatterName: Renew the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation (TEUC) program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the penalties for drag racing.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the penalties for drag racing.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to make drag racing a felony.
Items.MatterName: State Legislature to make drag racing a felony.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to adopt more stringent legislation for punishing dangerous and deadly drivers, particularly in relation to drivers who cause death or serious injury due to intoxication or criminal negligence.
Items.MatterName: Punishing dangerous and deadly drivers, particularly in relation to drivers who cause death or serious injury due to intoxication or criminal negligence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a cause of action against firearms manufacturers and dealers.
Items.MatterName: Creating a cause of action against certain weapons dealers and manufacturers.

Items.Title: Roll Call
Resolutions
General Discussion

Resolution calling upon United States Attorney General John Ashcroft and the Department of Justice to reopen the case of Emmett Till, in light of the discovery of new information, for a complete and thorough investigation into his 1955 murder, and to move aggressively to indict the murderers of Emmett Till, and bring them to justice.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice-vote.  The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Member Oddo.
Items.MatterName: US Attorney General John Ashcroft and the Dep't of Justice to reopen the case of Emmett Till.
